alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 26 at 9:01AM CDT until April 02 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Kaskaskia River at Carlyle TW. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 48 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kaskaskia River at Carlyle TW. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 425.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 AM CDT Saturday was 425.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near 425.0 feet through the early next week. It will then fall below flood stage early Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 423.5 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Tue Wed Thu Kaskaskia River Carlyle TW 423.5 425.0 Sat 8 am 425.0 424.9 424.9 424.9 424. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
